page.title: 02OLD DEER PARK, ARUNDEL
page.content: The Park is little more than enclosed Downland. It is used in parts for grazing sheep thus preserving the short turf which was once a prominent feature of the South Downs. Small crops of maize, swede, etc are grown to provide cover for pheasants. Long stretches of grassland provide gallops for the racehorses from the Castle Stables. Bark tracks have also been laid down for the horses. Small rowing boats on Swanbourne Lake offer recreation for all ages. Part of the long main valley is used as a rifle range and red flags are flown at various points to warn walkers when shooting is going on. Some logging takes place when mature plantations are felled.
